description.narrative: PEAC will use the funds provided by GGF in its efforts to eliminate the use and production of the Chlorpyrifo pesticide in China. China is currently the biggest global producer of Chlropyrifo, which has been identified as a Persistent Organic Pollutant (POPs) chemical. PEAC will research the use and effects of Chlorpyrifo through case studies and field surveys in the province of Yunnan. This research will be summarized and used as example for other areas of the country. The project will aim to identify, and share, safer alternatives to use of the pesticide. PEAC will work to educate the public to the effects and alternatives identified through workshops and trainings as well as online courseware and a public awareness campaign. This campaign will call for stronger regulations and policies around the use and production at national and provincial levels.
